programme.title: Así en el barrio como en el cielo
Nada Personal
programme.desc: Nada Personal es una serie que trae Discovery Channel para Latinoamérica donde asesinos a sueldo son contratados para matar sin piedad.La serie tipo documental Nada Personal es presentada por Steve Schirippa, conocido por la serie de mafiosos “Los Soprano”. En este programa se verán historias verídicas de asesinatos hechos por contrato.En cada capítulo de la serie, se narra la historia de un trabajo profesional que trata de cómo se contacta, las instrucciones dadas al asesino para llevar a cabo las peticiones del cliente.

programme.title: Mayfair Witches
programme.desc: Rowan makes a shocking discovery but has to deal with it alone; a tragic event brings Rowan closer to the Mayfairs -- and Lasher; Sip falls deeper down the rabbit hole of the key necklace.

programme.title: Mayfair Witches
programme.desc: Rowan inadvertently discovers her role in a prophecy that's held the Mayfair family for generations; Sip's investigation reaches its conclusion, uncovering secrets that could tarnish both Rowan's family and his role in the Talamasca.

programme.title: Mayfair Witches
programme.desc: Neurosurgeon Rowan Fielding has a problem -- when she gets mad, she kills with her mind; her search for answers sends her toward her secretive biological family; in New Orleans, Deirdre Mayfair is desperate to escape from her aunt's oppressive house.

programme.title: Mayfair Witches
programme.desc: Wracked with grief over Ellie's death, Rowan is out of control and unfit to perform surgeries; her paranoia that someone is following her is proven true; in New Orleans, Deirdre and her mysterious companion Lasher work together to draw Rowan home.

programme.title: Mayfair Witches
programme.desc: In the aftermath of Deirdre's grisly death, Rowan searches for safety in a strange city; Sip provides Rowan with a safe house while he investigates Deirdre's murder; Lasher makes contact with Rowan, but not in the way one might expect.

programme.title: Mayfair Witches
programme.desc: At Deirdre's funeral, Rowan is plunged into the world of the infamous Mayfair family; Uncle Cortland and Aunt Carlotta present diverging views on Lasher; Rowan must choose whom to trust and face the dire consequences; Sip identifies Deirdre's killer.

programme.title: Mayfair Witches
programme.desc: Trapped in the First Street House, Rowan and Sip must confront its many mysteries in order to escape; Rowan grapples with an inconceivable offer; Sip's sister Odette makes a horrifying discovery.

programme.title: Mayfair Witches
programme.desc: Desperate to relinquish Lasher, Rowan reaches out to her extended Mayfair family for help; Rowan must trust their unique process, a sacred ritual; Sip's search for answers takes him back to the Talamasca.

programme.title: The Cow
programme.desc: Upon arriving at a remote cabin for a getaway, a woman and her boyfriend discover another couple already staying there. They decide to share the rental for the night, but the boyfriend's disappearance sparks a race for answers.

programme.title: The Lost King
programme.desc: The true story of amateur historian Philippa Langley, who took on Britain's most eminent historians, forcing them to rethink the legacy of a controversial ruler.

programme.title: The Opening Act
programme.desc: A stand-up comedian encounters relentless hecklers, drunken groupies and hard-to-impress DJs after landing a gig as an emcee for his idol.

programme.title: Rare Objects
programme.desc: A young woman with a traumatic past seeks to rebuild her life when she begins working at a New York City antique shop.

programme.title: Monica
programme.desc: A woman returns home to care for her ailing mother, whom she hasn't seen in years.

programme.title: The Almond and the Seahorse
programme.desc: An archaeologist and an architect fight to reimagine a future after a traumatic brain injury leaves them adrift from the people they love.

programme.title: Life Upside Down
programme.desc: Three couples who know one another are stuck at home during the beginning of lockdown.

programme.title: Spin Me Round
programme.desc: Flown to an Italian immersion program on her company's dime, what starts as a romantic getaway devolves into chaos.

programme.title: Christmas Eve in Miller's Point
programme.desc: A family gathers on Christmas Eve for what could be the last holiday in their ancestral home. As the night wears on and tensions arise, one of the teenagers sneaks out with her friends to claim the wintry suburb for her own.

programme.title: Christmas Eve in Miller's Point
programme.desc: A family gathers on Christmas Eve for what could be the last holiday in their ancestral home. As the night wears on and tensions arise, one of the teenagers sneaks out with her friends to claim the wintry suburb for her own.

programme.title: Christmas With the Campbells
programme.desc: When Jesse is dumped right before the holidays by her boyfriend, Shawn, his parents convince her to still spend Christmas with them, and Shawn's handsome cousin, while Shawn is away.

programme.title: Silent Night
programme.desc: A couple invite their closest friends for Christmas dinner at their idyllic home in the English countryside. The world outside is facing impending doom, and no amount of gifts, games or wine can make mankind's imminent destruction go away.

programme.title: Bar Fight!
programme.desc: Having split everything in their lives after their break-up, a man and a woman must compete in a ridiculous custody battle for their prized drinking bar.

programme.title: Pretty Problems
programme.desc: A couple on the rocks are pulled along by absurdly wealthy strangers for a wine country getaway that turns into the most unhinged weekend of their lives.

programme.title: Eli Roth's History of Horror
programme.desc: The evolution of slashers, from Freddy Krueger to Candyman to the terrifying Hannibal Lecter in the '90s, to torture porn in the 2000s as a response to post-9/11 panic.

programme.title: Eli Roth's History of Horror
programme.desc: The fear that demons will enter one's body and make one do terrible things inspires some of the most frightening films ever made, including the masterpieces "Rosemary's Baby" and "The Exorcist.".

programme.title: Eli Roth's History of Horror
programme.desc: Monsters hold a special place in the history of horror as the killer predators in nature; the nightmare creatures of the fantastic are waiting to escape.

programme.title: Eli Roth's History of Horror
programme.desc: Modern vampires come in many guises, but they all address a fascination with sex and death; from the ghastly Count Orlok to the glam vampires of "True Blood," thirsty fiends are endlessly appealing.

programme.title: Eli Roth's History of Horror
programme.desc: Ghost movies have been with movie viewers since the dawn of cinema; some ghosts are benevolent, some ghosts are malicious, but they all represent the mystery of what happens to people after death.

programme.title: Eli Roth's History of Horror
programme.desc: Zombies are the monsters of the 21st century, and America's major contribution to horror; a look at what set off zombie fever leads to George Romero, who made zombies a metaphor for social ills.

programme.title: Eli Roth's History of Horror
programme.desc: Slasher films make a killing in the '80s, but their violence, perceived misogyny and endless sequels almost end the genre; supernatural killers Chucky and Freddy save them from extinction.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: As the Terminal Islanders adjust to their new surroundings, Chester tries to provide for his family, while fending off the evil that follows him; Henry reels from the trauma of his imprisonment; Asako sees bad omens; Amy takes up a new job.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: Chester, in search of a better life, is treated with hostility by his fellow Americans; Luz hopes to be accepted by Henry and Asako in their new home as the Japanese American community celebrates Obon, a festival to commemorate the dead.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: The Japanese Americans are forced to undertake a humiliating exercise that divides the community; Chester comes face to face with a man who forces him to question his very nature; Luz, stricken by grief, is forced to make an important choice.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: A story of the past provides insight into the present evil that stalks the Terminal Islanders; Chester returns home to his family; Henry and Asako are faced with a difficult decision.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: The Nakayamas have been torn apart; Chester searches for the person he believes can help, by any means necessary; an outbreak in the community forces Amy to act, though she's caught between doing what she's told and doing what's right.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: Chester and Luz have reached a turning point in their relationship; Amy must take matters into her own hands as she's tormented by a powerful nemesis; Chester meets a boy who gives him answers.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: The Terminal Islanders return home to find that things have changed since they left; the Nakayamas, still tense from the pain they've inflicted on one another, must come together to battle the spirit that threatens their future.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: Henry and Asako look to the past to provide answers to their current turmoil; Chester and Luz grapple with their identities in hopes of saving those who are dearest to them; Amy and Yamato-san struggle to once again assimilate into American life.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.sub-title: Infamy: A Sparrow in a Swallow's Nest
programme.desc: In 1941 Chester Nakayama is caught between his insular Japanese American neighborhood on Terminal Island and his current all-American life; extreme circumstances push his community and personal life to the brink, all while someone watches closely.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.sub-title: Infamy: All the Demons Are Still in Hell
programme.desc: After Pearl Harbor, the Terminal Islanders are evicted from their homes and must find shelter elsewhere; while Henry, separated from his family, faces injustice at the hands of the government, Chester engages in a paranoid search for answers.
